meanings.definition: To remove the vocal cords from (an animal) to prevent it from making loud noises.
meanings.sent1: The vet devocalizes the dog to keep it quiet.
meanings.sent2: The farmer devocalizes the rooster to avoid disturbing the neighbors.
meanings.sent3: The noisy parrot was devocalized, now it communicates through gestures.
meanings.sent4: After the surgery, the cat seemed as if its voice had been devocalized.
meanings.sent5: The act of devocalizing the crow made the whole forest peaceful.

meanings.definition: To render (a person or animal) unable to produce vocal sounds.
meanings.sent1: The illness devocalizes the singer, leaving him silent.
meanings.sent2: The magician's spell devocalizes the audience, leaving them speechless.
meanings.sent3: The prankster devocalizes his friend by stealing his voice box.
meanings.sent4: The silence in the library devocalizes even the loudest whispers.
meanings.sent5: The mysterious potion devocalizes anyone who drinks it, turning them into mime artists.
